greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Denominators of fractional partial quotients appearing in a continued fraction for the power series Sum_{n>=0} x^(2^n - 1)/(n+1)^s.
comment: A123725(n) = (A007814(n) + 2)*(-1)^A073089(n+1) are the numerators of the partial quotients.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
formula: a(n) = (A007814(n) + 1)^2 = A001511(n)^2 for n>=1, with a(0)=1, where A007814(n) is the exponent of the highest power of 2 dividing n.
Multiplicative with a(2^e) = (e + 1)^2, a(p^e) = 1 for odd prime p. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 31 2018
example: Surprisingly, the following analog of the Riemann zeta function:
may be expressed by the continued fraction:
such that the (2^n-1)-th convergent = Sum_{k=0..n} x^(2^k-1)/(k+1)^s,
and b(n) = A007814(n) the exponent of highest power of 2 dividing n.
mathematica: Join[{1}, Table[(1 + IntegerExponent[n, 2])^2, {n, 1, 50}]] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 01 2018 *)
program: (MAGMA) [1] cat [(Valuation(n, 2) + 1)^2: n in [1..50]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 01 2018
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 12 2006
ext: Ref to A001511 added by _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Dec 22 2013
